All kind of basic facilities like laboratory services, operation theatres, delivery rooms, six general wards, nine private rooms, Neonatal Intensive Care unit, ICU, X-ray, Sonography, dialysis etc. are available. Major Services are available like, General Medicine, Pediatrics, Gynecology, ophthalmology, General surgery, orthopedic, Skin, E.N.T, nephrology, Dental, Physiotherapy services. -Yearly, about 77,000 patients are seen in OPD and more than 7500 are admitted for further health management. We also run Weekly Dispensary at Kudkas village of Dang district and providing medical services to community of interior area. Community Health Project:- - Nutrition and Child Health Projects to fight with malnutrition problems among 0 to 6 years children - Adopted 101 Anganwadi of Gandevi, chikhli blocks & 45 Anganwadi of Vansda Block of Navsari District under Child Health & Nutrition project - Antenatal Care Project to improve maternal health - Geriatric project to take care of health of elderly people focusing on non-communicable diseases in 15 villages. - Adolescent Health Projects to improve overall health of adolescents - Health Education project to create awareness among community about different diseases Rural Development Activities:- - Sanitation-Project help to build low cost toilets  uptill more than 150 toilet covered - Strengthening & Capacity building programs for micro-saving groups of women - Skill development programs to improve their livelihood under women empowerments project. - Sewing classes for adolescent and women  more than 900 adolescent & women trained by this classes - Sanitary Napkin project run by group of women to provide low cost & eco-friendly sanitary napkins to girls & women - Tutorials programs helps to strengthen primary education of more than 200 tribal children - PARODH Child Education and Development Centre- a residential facility for children of migrant families, broken houses, alcoholics & orphans

Methane is used for energy generation for captive consumption of day school and hostel establishment in Kamrej near Surat city. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Human development and Research Foundation (HDRF) is established in 2005 and register with Government of India through Rehabilitation Council of India (RCI), National Trust, Government of Gujarat under  The persons with Disabilities - Equal opportunities Protection of Rights and full participation ) Act,1995, VTP ( GCVT ) Online Registration also and all other statutory bodies of Govt. both at the State and Central Level. The Sole objective of HDRF is to offer services in following core areas throughout the State of Gujarat in western India. a. Skills Training and Placement. b. Women and Child Development. c. Rehabilitation of Mentally retarded children. Mental Health d. Education and Social programmes or activities. 1) Our organization is working as a Training Partner The Centre for Entrepreneurship Development  Gujarat under Assistance for tuition fees for Enhancement of skills for 1000 beneficiaries are trained & will be placed as per the scheme. 2) Our organization is working as a Training Partner with The Centre for Entrepreneurship Development  Gujarat under Integrated Skill Development Scheme for Textile Sector (ISDS) Ministry of Textile, Govt.of India for 1000 beneficiaries are trained & will be placed as per the scheme. 3) Our organization is work under the project of National Urban Livelihoods Mission. 4) In collaboration with one of the leading training organization of Gujarat, we imparted training to approx. 10,000 beneficiaries out of which 5000 have been successfully placed in organizations both in private and govt such as Gujarat Govt offices, Reliance, Big Bazaar, Vodafone etc. ie, Umeed Project  2010 to 2014

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Indian Academy for Self Employed Women (IASEW) or SEWA Academy is a sister organisation of SEWA (Self Employed Womens Association) based in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India. Initiated by SEWA as an activity in 1991, IASEW got registered as an autonomous charity trust in 2005 and has been since trying to make itself sustainable. IASEW is the focal point for all of training, capacity-building, research and communication efforts. IASEW functions as our members university, introducing the poor informal sector women to formal learning environment. IASEW primary objective is to take the poor informal sector womens movement forward. It does this in four ways - through training and capacity-building, action-oriented research focusing on poor women members, and by building strong communication channels, within the organization as well as with the outside world. 1. Training; IASEWs trainings are driven by the core belief that everyone has potential and ability. The training programmes are a collective approach to overall development of women and the capacity- building programmes cut across all the requirements. The programmes help to develop womens self-esteem, confidence and leadership skills. The expertise from SEWAs sister organizations, which are autonomous but integrated, enriches the training programmes and vice versa. 2. Research; IASEW has been involved in research related work since the inception of SEWA in 1972. Thus, IASEWs Research division was setup in the year 1991. The research conducted at IASEW always had its focus on the poor self employed, on their present living conditions, challenges and struggles. Ours is an action-oriented approach to make an impact at the policy level. 3. Literacy; The women participating in trainings provided by IASEW were both literate and illiterate, from different areas of city and villages. The illiterate women said: We would like to study! The enthusiasm led to the initiation of Literacy Classes in 1992. The members sought education, which was easy to understand and which would help them in life. Mobile Van: The Mobile Van was started on 3 October 2009. Equipped with video, CDs on issues related to poor informal sector, and Megaphone, the Mobile Van visits the people in their neighbourhoods and arranges replays of video and radio. Library: Libraries have been set up in working class areas. This was initiated from February 2003. Akashganga Club: Akashganga is a magazine for young girls, initiated by IASEW. The variety of activities undertaken by the club are story-telling, hygiene education, adolescent fairs, stage shows, sports day and cultural programmes, festival related programmes, fancy dress competition, exposure trips to science city, and Gandhi ashram. Cultural Programmes: Cultural programmes are organized to present the talent of community women and girls. 4. Communication; Communication plays a very crucial role in the lives of poor women workers. There is a great need for communication, between self employed women, and between them and the public, policy planners, and other government officials. The different print media of communication are Anasooya, Akashganga, E-newsletter, and electronic media of communication are Video SEWA and Rudi no Radio.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ISRCDE is registered under Public Trust Act 1950 & Societies Registration Act 1860 F/1429, Ahmadabad What GAP is and what GAP does Gujarat AIDS Awareness and Prevention (GAP) is an unit of ISRCDE Mission of GAP GAP is the lead non-governmental organization in the field of HIV/AIDS and sexual health. It works to raise the information level and awareness of HIV/AIDS and sexual health, influence on attitude, opinion, policy, prevention and professional practices. GAP cares for infected and affected people. It is a resource centre for advise, information, advocacy and expertise. Collaborating with other organizations of India and abroad, GAP aims to create an understanding towards those affected by HIV/AIDS. It is an advanced centre for care and counseling for infected and affected people.
